chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Deandrea L Hardman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Deandrea L Hardman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Deandrea L Hardman was found guilty of Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED & STAYED. Concur to 21CF1034.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: 21CF1034

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia, alcohol and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Shall not live anywhere illegal controlled substances are present.
Random UA & BA testing at least every other week. DNA on file.

timeConds.notes: With huber. Stayed until 8/1/22. Permanently stayed if def completes AODA and follow up treatment prior to 8/1/22. Agent to contact court prior to 8/1/22 and update court on progress.

Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 5/6/22 sent electronically to DCJ

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Mark Walter Frank.  Valerian Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jt: plea ct 12. DISM 13, 14. I/S 18 ic, 24 es cc to 21CF1034 for 30 months probation. Argument. Statement by DE. DNA on file. 

  Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 12.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count # 13, 14  . 

  Victim Rights Compliance

IMPOSED AND STAYED

COUNT #    12  
-serve 3.5 years in WSP, bifurcated into:
-initial confinement: 18 months
-extended supervision: 24 months
-cc 21CF1034 to:

Challenge Incarceration Program: Eligible
Substance Abuse Program: Eligible

Stayed for 30 months probation cc 21CF1034

CONDITIONS:
-Serve 120 days  in the DCJ, w/huber, STAYAED until 8/1/22. Permanently stayed if DE completes AODA and follow up treatment prior to 8/1/22. Agent to contact court prior to 8/1/22 and update court on progress. 

-Not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription

-Random UA and BA testing at least every other week
-DNA on file

-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment

-Shall not live anywhere illegal controlled substances are present

COURT COSTS:
Ct # 12
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-Days credit for time served:  109 (1/18/22 - 5/6/22)
-Days credit if revoked: 109

DE advised of post-conviction rights
